options.B: High-level expert group on universal health coverage
options.D: Committee on Integration of Health Services

questions.explanation: The high-level expert group (HLEG) on universal health coverage under the aegis of the PlanningCommission of India suggested a 3.5 year bachelor degree course in medical education for ruralhealth services.This was planned for the 12th five-year plan (2012-2017). questions.question: Who was appointed as the chairman of the Health Survey and Development Committee in1943?
questions.explanation: Sir Joseph William Bhore was appointed as the chairman of the Health Survey and DevelopmentCommittee in 1943. This committee was hence named the Bhore committee.737

questions.question: Which health planning committee proposed the 3 million plan?
questions.explanation: The 3 million plan was proposed by the Bhore Committee.It proposed to set up the following in the long-term:•Primary health units with 75-bedded hospitals for each 10,000 to 20,000 population•Secondary units with 650 beds⚫ District hospitals with 2,500 beds•As a short-term measure, it was proposed that each PHC must cater to 40,000 people and have:• 2 medical officers, 4 public health nurses, 1 nurse4 midwives, 4 dais, 2 sanitary inspectors, 2 health assistants• 1 pharmacist• 15 other class IV employees

questions.question: What is the provision of preventive, curative, and promotional health services to everyindividual called?
questions.explanation: Comprehensive health care as stated by the Bhore committee means giving integrated preventive,curative, and promotional health care to every individual, irrespective of their ability to pay.

questions.question: In the inventory management of drug stores, which of the following is a component of the VED method?
questions.explanation: The 'D' in the VED method stands for desirable. VED is a method of inventory management used mainly in drug stores and pharmacies. The drugs are classified in three categories as follows: • V - Vital drugs. Items whose absence cannot be tolerated (10% of total items). • E - Essential drugs. Items whose absence can be tolerated for some time (40% of total items). • D - Desirable drugs. Items whose absence can be tolerated for a long time (50% of total items).
